summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice weekly roundup email from March 20, 2020, summarizing recent DOJ announcements and media coverage. It includes Attorney General Barr directing prosecutors to prioritize coronavirus-related fraud investigations, mentioning the creation of a task force on prison misconduct following Jeffrey Epstein's death, and covering other unrelated criminal cases.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.role: Attorney General of the United States
persons.context: Issued directives to prioritize investigations of coronavirus-related fraud and announced the creation of a task force to address prison misconduct following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the inmate who killed himself at a federal jail, which prompted the Attorney General to create a task force on prison misconduct.

persons.name: Alex Azar
persons.role: Secretary of Health and Human Services
persons.context: Stated that HHS networks were not penetrated in a cyber incident and that the department had taken defensive action.

persons.name: Lev Asian Dermen
persons.context: A Los Angeles businessman convicted of a billion-dollar tax fraud scheme involving international money laundering and a Utah polygamist sect.

persons.name: Robert Leslie Stencil
persons.context: A Charlotte man who pitched plans for an electric car manufacturing plant to a North Carolina county official, mentioned in a story about green energy scams.

persons.name: Deborah Murray
persons.context: Former economic development director of Caldwell County, North Carolina, who recounted being approached by Robert Stencil with a business proposal.

persons.name: David Shortell
persons.context: CNN journalist credited for the excerpt on Attorney General Barr's directive on coronavirus fraud investigations.

persons.name: Byron Tau
persons.context: Wall Street Journal journalist credited for the excerpt on the tax fraud conviction of Lev Asian Dermen.

persons.name: Marjie Lundstrom
persons.context: FairWarning journalist credited for the excerpt on green energy scams.

persons.name: Pete Williams
persons.context: NBC News journalist credited for related coverage on coronavirus scams.

events.title: Barr directs prosecutors to prioritize coronavirus fraud
events.description: Attorney General William Barr sent a memo to U.S. attorneys nationwide directing them to prioritize investigations of fraud and hacking related to the coronavirus pandemic.

events.title: DOJ Weekly Roundup released
events.description: The U.S. Department of Justice issued its weekly roundup of news and announcements, covering topics including coronavirus fraud, a prison misconduct task force, and other criminal cases.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death in jail
events.description: Wealthy financier Jeffrey Epstein killed himself while in federal custody. This event is cited as a reason for creating a task force on prison misconduct.

events.title: HHS cyber incident
events.description: A 'cyber incident' involved the computer networks of the Department of Health and Human Services, though officials stated the networks were not penetrated and were operating normally.

events.title: Conviction in billion-dollar tax fraud scheme
events.description: Businessman Lev Asian Dermen was convicted by a federal jury in Salt Lake City on counts of conspiracy and money laundering in a billion-dollar tax fraud scheme.

keyFacts: Attorney General William Barr directed federal prosecutors to prioritize investigations of fraud and hacking exploiting the coronavirus pandemic.
Barr announced the creation of a special DOJ task force to address criminal misconduct by federal Bureau of Prisons officers, citing the jail where Jeffrey Epstein died as a catalyst.
The document confirms Epstein's death by suicide while in federal custody.
A cyber incident targeted the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services networks, but officials stated they were not penetrated.
The roundup includes coverage of unrelated criminal cases, including a billion-dollar tax fraud conviction and green energy scams.
